title: Advanced Language for Career Applications: High School
subject: Arts and Humanities: World Languages (2024-)

document.title: Idaho Content Standards  Advanced Language for Career Applications

96C185593C9E4D1EBC01C4909ACAD86D.description:
adhere to ethical codes of conduct by following copyright laws and
restrictions and using technology responsibly.

08B39C4B239948AAA238FFF1B85CBFCC.description:
set goals and reflect on progress in using the target language for career
development and advancement;

7DCD8B0D13A44888BCDD20E5CE1E6158.description:
communicate effectively in the target language in career development
activities such as mock interviews;

E053422702AB404DAA553A0741CADF61.description:
demonstrate an understanding of relevant ethical and legal issues such as
confidentiality and fiduciary responsibility;

1E0B60A483E14357B087C2CD2AAF0171.description:
demonstrate professional etiquette appropriate to the professional, business,
or industry setting;

266094A0BF724C65AF10A9215251B270.description:
CAREER APPLICATIONS: The student demonstrates professional standards/employability skills as required in the
professional, business, or industry setting.

9357EF376B2E4696B8D00F1E13482DFE.description:
communicate using advanced technical vocabulary, jargon, and abbreviations
necessary for communicating with employers, clients, and other professionals
in the target language.

8E5D0E38ECAC462496C2F4395676E94D.description:
demonstrate an understanding of different dialects used in communities
served by the profession, business, or industry;

6753686F4AF34B9883B97D79B11AB6CE.description:
use various strategies to infer the meaning of unfamiliar words or phrases in
business or industry-specific texts, audio, and audiovisual materials such as
trade publications, case studies, business journals, or conference
presentations;

7DDA7717A69D42D7ACD2E24F115E7D26.description:
PROFESSIONAL, BUSINESS, OR INDUSTRY-SPECIFIC TERMINOLOGY: The student effectively communicates using the target language and cultural understanding in
rehearsed and unrehearsed situations using professional, business, or industry-specific
terminology.

A9EBA994653240AA847A5AAF0062E48A.description:
create written, oral, and visual presentations of professional, business, or
industry-related information to inform, persuade, or motivate an audience.

81C3A5A7616743A4847F606E596FB185.description:
design and present an effective professional, business, or industry-related
product using appropriate register for the audience, occasion, and purpose;

5740360AFFE3493EA180FE0D0207233F.description:
present analyzed data and communicate findings in a variety of formats
specific to the professional, business, or industry setting;

57FE2384F1C54B7898D82BEF7C72494A.description: apply spoken and written conventions and mechanics;

A4688020C1D84B91AAAA6DBE94187AD7.description:
PRESENTATIONAL COMMUNICATION: SPEAKING AND WRITING: The student presents business or industry-related information in the target language both
orally and in writing using a mixture of sentences and connected discourse with appropriate
and applicable grammar structures and processes with an awareness of situational uses of
language in cultural contexts.

CB64253D0BD145F2901C45342C5D6848.description:
understand and follow directives and procedures within the context of the
professional, business, or industry setting.

9312B4D8071E463CB11BA193350F853B.description:
apply data to evaluate performance or provide solutions to problems specific
to the professional, business, or industry setting;

DF67FC5A817440C7A4CBA4F3A9555496.description:
paraphrase the main idea and supporting details from professional, business,
or industry-related texts, audio, and audiovisual materials;

BB88F45B25FB4F22A674F531AFE07FE7.description:
employ appropriate verbal, nonverbal, and listening comprehension skills to
enhance relationships in the professional, business, or industry setting;

D3A5E1D601D342BEBEB283AA386C87AB.description:
INTERPRETIVE COMMUNICATION: READING AND LISTENING: The student comprehends connected statements appropriate to the target language and the
professional, business, or industry setting from culturally authentic print, digital, audio, and
audiovisual materials.

C329F161F4654DE0B80330139ED662AB.description:
interact and react in writing using culturally appropriate expressions, formally
and informally, and style.

2E11CB58F81E4557AF9FAFDACF954490.description:
interact and react in spoken conversation using culturally appropriate
expressions, formally and informally, and gestures; and

6C1BCA92E13E4A74BC3989D1F76D266C.description:
give and receive complex oral instructions to perform tasks specific to the
professional, business, or industry setting;

38064C43E021426CBA8BC4A0DB6206AD.description: evaluate the effectiveness of one's own and others' communication;

D83A871001594239B5FD1FE0F65B9B91.description:
identify and use appropriate strategies for communicating with diverse
individuals;

4490854F5AA14685ACCAA5EDA610029D.description:
participate appropriately in conversations and in informal written exchanges
related to the professional, business, or industry setting;

03D47701E9A243C2A7A12FBAD263AF6C.description:
INTERPERSONAL COMMUNICATION: SPEAKING AND WRITING: The student negotiates meaning through the spoken and written exchange of information in
the target language in rehearsed and unrehearsed situations in a variety of contexts
appropriate to the professional, business, or industry setting.
